rdf:Description.dc:title: Where's the Money?
rdf:Description.dc:subject: eBook Business Issues
rdf:Description.dc:source: Publishing 2001: Attitudes to Technological Change, 2001, BPI Communications.
rdf:Description.dc:description: Article presents a strategic framework to assist publishers in determining in which formats, platforms and channels they should be making their content available.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Optimizing Multi-Channel Publishing
rdf:Description.dc:subject: eBook Business Issues
rdf:Description.dc:source: Digital Content Management for Publishing conference on July 24, 2001.

rdf:Description.about: eBook Supply Chain: Opportunities and Challenges
rdf:Description.dc:title: eBook Supply Chain: Opportunities and Challenges
rdf:Description.dc:subject: eBook Business Issues
rdf:Description.dc:source: Supply Chain Seminar, Frankfurt Book Fair, on October 9, 2001

rdf:Description.dc:title: Common eBook Formats
rdf:Description.dc:subject: eBook Production Issues
rdf:Description.dc:description: Article describing the most common formats for eBooks and the advantages of each.

rdf:Description.dc:title: File Formats for Digital Distribution
rdf:Description.dc:source: Presentation given at Seybold San Francisco, 2001 on September 27, 2001
rdf:Description.dc:description: eBook formats and recommendations on which publishers should implement

rdf:Description.dc:title: Publisher Conversion Strategy
rdf:Description.dc:subject: eBook Production Issues
rdf:Description.dc:description: cost-effective methods that publishers can use to incrementally convert their books into various eBook formats based on expected sales in each format. Presentation also includes high-level diagrams illustrating the most common types of conversion and associated issues.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Distributed Print-on-Demand
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Print On Demand
rdf:Description.dc:source: PIRA Digital Print World conference, London, on February 13, 2001
rdf:Description.dc:description: The presentation covers the economic drivers of print-on-demand, distinctions between central and distributed print-on-demand and addresses barriers to acceptance of distributed print-on-demand.

rdf:Description.about: Print-on-Demand in the Book Supply Chain
rdf:Description.dc:title: Print-on-Demand in the Book Supply Chain
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Print On Demand
rdf:Description.dc:description: Article on Print-on-Demand discussing its use at various levels of the Book Supply Chain: Publisher, Wholesaler and Retailer. The article encompasses material from a number of 2001 presentations on Print-on-Demand issues.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Clearing the Rights Bottleneck
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Rights Management
rdf:Description.dc:source: Discussion notes from Publishers Lunch, New York, June 20, 2001
rdf:Description.dc:description: Presents the case that all publishing transactions have a rights element that is only growing more important.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Publishing Dimensions
rdf:Description.dc:subject: eBooks, Data Conversion, Rights Management, Print on Demand, POD
rdf:Description.dc:description: Services for the publishing industry including conversion of PDF, Quark and printed documents into OEB, Microsoft, Adobe, XML and Palm formats

rdf:Description.dc:title: Quiet Island Books
rdf:Description.dc:subject: eBooks, Publishing Dimensions Services, Distribution, Print on Demand, POD
rdf:Description.dc:description: eBook and Print-on-Demand distribution services for the publishing industry

rdf:Description.dc:title: Digital Galley
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Publishing Dimensions Services, Book Publishing, Book Marketing, Advance Reader Copy, ARC, Bound Galley
rdf:Description.dc:description: Marketing services for the print and digital publishing industry

rdf:Description.dc:title: ePublishing Consulting
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Publishing Dimensions Services, Book Publishing, ePublishing, Consulting, strategy, eBook
rdf:Description.dc:description: Publishing Dimensions delivers digital content strategy, operations and marketing consulting services.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Publishing Consulting
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Publishing Dimensions Services, Book Publishing, Publishing, Consulting, Strategy, Production, Operations, Finance
rdf:Description.dc:description: Publishing Dimensions offers a wide range of consulting services within traditional publishing functions. Those services include Corporate and Functional Strategy, Production, Inventory Management, Warehousing/Fulfillment, Order Management, Customer Service, Rights Management, and Finance

rdf:Description.dc:title: Conversion Services
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Publishing Dimensions Services
eBooks, Data Conversion, OEB, XML, Print on Demand, POD
rdf:Description.dc:description: Services for the publishing industry including conversion of PDF, Quark and printed documents into OEB, Microsoft, Adobe, XML and Palm formats

rdf:Description.dc:title: Rights Management Services
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Publishing Dimensions Services, Book Publishing, Contracts, Rights Management, DRM, Digital Rights Management
rdf:Description.dc:description: Publishing Dimensions provides innovative solutions in capturing information on publishers' largest asset: the rights that they control and exploit, their publishing rights

rdf:Description.dc:title: Quiet Island Books Press Release
rdf:Description.dc:subject: eBooks, Publishing Dimensions Services, Distribution, Print on Demand, POD
rdf:Description.dc:description: Press release announcing Quiet Island Books, an eBook and Print-on-Demand Distributor for small publishers.

rdf:Description.about: A Fire Upon the Deep Press Release
rdf:Description.dc:title: A Fire Upon the Deep Press Release Press Release
rdf:Description.dc:subject: eBooks, Science Fiction, Vernor Vinge, A Fire Upon the Deep, Conversion Services
rdf:Description.dc:description: Press release announcing the annotated edition of A Fire Upon the Deep, Vernor Vinge's science fiction classic presaging elements of the Internet.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Composition Services
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Publishing Dimensions Services, Book Publishing, Editorial, Page Makeup, Composition, Production, Book Production, eBooks, XML, XSL
rdf:Description.dc:description: Publishing Dimensions provides an XML based page composition service that significantly reduces cost, decreases turnaround and increases usability of print files.

rdf:Description.dc:title: XML in Book Publishing
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Production, Technology
rdf:Description.dc:source: Digital Smart Factory Panel Discussion, June 24, 2003
rdf:Description.dc:description: Describes a framework for implementing XML within the editorial and production workflows of traditional publishing operations.

rdf:Description.dc:title: DOI Building Blocks
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Production, Technology
rdf:Description.dc:description: Describes the process of implementing Digital Object Identifiers to increase web traffic and sales.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Menage
rdf:Description.dc:subject: menage, bisexual, erotica
rdf:Description.dc:description: Philadelphia bookstore owner Kate comes home from work one day to find her two flatmates in bed together. Joe - a sensitive composer - is mortified. Sean - an irrepressible bad boy - asks her to join in. As they embark on a polysexual menage a trois, Kate wants nothing more than to keep both her admirers happy. However, things become complicated. Kate has told everyone that Sean is gay, but now he and Kate are acting like lovers. Can the three of them live happily ever after - together?

rdf:Description.dc:title: Captive Flesh, The
rdf:Description.dc:subject: erotica, BDSM
rdf:Description.dc:description: Eighteenth-century French convent girls Marietta and Claudine learn that their stay at the opulent Algerian home of their handsome and powerful host, Kasim, requires something in return--their complete surrender to the ecstasy of pleasure in pain. Kasim's decadent orgies also require the services of Gabriel, whose exquisite longing for Marietta's awakened lust cannot be contained--not even by the shackles that bind his tortured flesh.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Elena's Conquest
rdf:Description.dc:subject: historical, erotica, BDSM
rdf:Description.dc:description: When Norman soldiers besiege a convent on a summer's day in 1070, a young Saxon girl, Elena, is taken captive. She is chosen by the dark and masterful Lord Aimery le Sabrenn to satisfy his savage desires. Captivated by his powerful masculinity, Elena is then horrified to discover she is not the only woman in his castle. Travel back in time and witness sexual jealousy in the time of William the Conqueror.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Strictly Confidential
rdf:Description.dc:subject: erotica, voyeurism
rdf:Description.dc:description: Carolyn Winters is a smooth-talking disc jockey at a hip LA radio station. Although known for her sexy banter over the airwaves, she leads a reclusive life, despite the urging of her flirtatious roommate, Dahlia. Carolyn grows dependent on living vicariously through Dahlia, eavesdropping and then covertly watching as her roomate's sexual behaviour becomes more and more bizarre. But then Dahlia is murdered, and Carolyn must overcome her fears in order to bring the killer to justice.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Crash Course
rdf:Description.dc:subject: erotica, menage
rdf:Description.dc:description: Kate is a successful management consultant. When she's asked to run a training course at an exclusive hotel at short notice, she thinks the stress will be too much. But three of the participants are young, attractive, powerful men, and Kate cannot resist the temptation to get to know them sexually as well as professionally. Her problem is that one of the women on the course is feeling left out. Jealousy and passion simmer beneath the surface as Kate tries to get the best performance out of her clients.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Odalisque
rdf:Description.dc:subject: erotica, BDSM
rdf:Description.dc:description: Beautiful but ruthless designer Auralie plots to bring about the downfall of her more virtuous cousin, Jeanine. Recently widowed but still young, wealthy and glamorous, Jeanine's passions are rekindled by Auralie's husband. But she is playing into Auralie's hands. Why are these cousins locked into this sexual feud? And what is the purpose of Jeanine's mysterious Confessor and his sordid underground sect?

rdf:Description.dc:title: Asking for Trouble
rdf:Description.dc:subject: erotica, BDSM, voyeurism
rdf:Description.dc:description: When Beth Bradshaw, the sexy manager of a fancy sexbar in Brighton, moves into a new flat she soon becomes aware she's being watched by a guy who lives across the street. Beth gets involved with him and Ilya turns out to be weirder and scarier than she could have imagined. She felt herself drawn into a web of seduction, dominance and submission and crime.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Handmaiden of Palmyra
rdf:Description.dc:subject: historical, erotica
rdf:Description.dc:description: Third-century Palmyra provides an exotic setting for this story of lust and ambition. While the hedonistic Palmyrenes feast on ripe fruits, heady wines and the pleasures of the flesh, battles are raging in neighbouring countries and Samoya, a beautiful woman, becomes involved in the conflict.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Noble Vices
rdf:Description.dc:subject: erotica, menage
rdf:Description.dc:description: Annabelle doesn't want to work. She wants to spend her time riding, attending exotic dinner parties and indulging herself in even more exotic sex...at her father's expense. Unfortunately daddy has other ideas, and when she totals his new Jaguar, it is the final straw. Sent to work in the City, Annabelle quickly finds that it is not easy to fit in, especially when what she thinks of as harmless, playful sex has most of her new acquantances reeling in shock.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Undercover Secrets
rdf:Description.dc:subject: erotica, BDSM
rdf:Description.dc:description:
Anna Caplin is an ambitious TV reporter. When her boss offers her a chance to infiltrate a secret medical institute, she grabs the opportunity, not realizing the institute specializes in sexual experimentation. It isn't long before Anna finds herself involved in some highly unorthodox situations with Doctor Galloway - the institute's director.
Then she meets the attractive but melancholy Frank, Doctor Galloway's son, who knows the secrets of the institute. Will Anne discover them before her taste for games of submission and control growns into an insatiable hunger?

rdf:Description.about: One Week in the Private House
rdf:Description.dc:title: One Week in the Private House
rdf:Description.dc:subject: erotica, BDSM
rdf:Description.dc:description: Jem is a petite, flame-haired, blue-eyed businesswoman. Lucy, tall, blonde and athletic, is a detective inspector. Julia is the slim, dark, bored wife of a financial speculator. Each arrives seperately in the strange, ritualistic, disciplined domain known as the Private House. Once they meet, nothing in the House will be the same again - nothing, that is, except the strict regime of obedience and sexuality.

rdf:Description.dc:description: When naughty Penny is walking in the woods one day, she is surprised to find a couple pony-carting. rdf:Description.dc:title: Deep Blue
rdf:Description.dc:subject: erotica, voyeurism, BDSM
rdf:Description.dc:description: Strange things are happening in the sleepy Devon spa town of Tawmouth, where women are having increasingly bizarre dreams. Are they the product of sexual yearnings or do they herald the return of a fantastical prehistoric deity, as Nich Mordaunt, scholar of erotic pagan ritual, belleves? Seaside smut meets the deeply perverse as peeping Toms, craven submissives and dastardly doms all face elemental forces far beyond their own imaginings. The perfect beach read!

rdf:Description.dc:title: Beast
rdf:Description.dc:subject: erotica, BDSM
rdf:Description.dc:description: Without time to draw breath from the indignities already heaped upon them, the three sisters of Disciplined Skin - blond Anna, redhead Beth, raven Gwen - are plunged into the new tortures and humiliations gleefully devised for them by their mysterious leather-clad captor Herr Abraham Barengelt. Putting its heroines through ordeals that range from mild to perversely bizarre, Beast is sure to confirm the reputation its author has already established for surreal erotic depravity that entertains as much as it arouses.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Letters to Chloe
rdf:Description.dc:subject: erotica, BDSM
rdf:Description.dc:description:
The letters were found in a locked briefcase in a London mansion. Shocking and explicit, they are all in the same hand, and all addressed to the same mysterious woman: Chloe.
From the very beginning, it is clear that the relationship between the writer and Chloe is no ordinary one. The letters describe a liaison governed by power; a liaison which transforms an innocent young woman into a powerful sexual enigma. Each letter pushes Chloe a little closer to the limits of sexual role-play, testing her obedience, her willingness to explore ever more extreme taboos. Until, as events reach their climax, the question must be asked; who is really in control.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Belle Submission
rdf:Description.dc:subject: erotica, BDSM
rdf:Description.dc:description: What better location for a finishing school for southern belles than in the fetid heat of Louisiana? Given the errant behaviour of the daughters of the plantation owners and farmers of the Old South, and with an aristocratic French descendant of the Marquis de Sade in charge, flagellation is bound to be on the curriculum. As the canes swish amid the scent of magnolia, it's a sure-fire bet that the men of the South will rise again and again.
